source_sentence: （二七）◎兄弟二人俱出家緣
translation: (27) - The two brothers both left home

source_sentence: 往昔之世，有兄弟二人，心樂佛法，出家學道。
translation: In a bygone era, there were two brothers who were delighted with the Buddha's teachings and left home to train on the path.

source_sentence: 其兄精懃，集眾善法，修阿練行，未久之頃，得羅漢道；其弟聰明，學問博識，誦三藏經，後為輔相請作門師，多與財錢，委使營造僧房塔寺。
translation: The older brother was diligent, collected many good qualities, cultivated the practice of araṇya, and before long attained the path of the arhat; the younger brother was intelligent, learned, and knowledgeable, recited the Tripiṭaka Sutra, and was later asked by the minister to be his disciple.

source_sentence: 時三藏法師，受其財物，將人經地，為造塔寺，基剎端嚴，堂宇瑩麗，制作之意，妙絕工匠。
translation: The Tripiṭaka master then accepted his wealth and property, took it to a sūtra site, and built a stūpa and temple with a dignified foundation, a beautiful building, and a sense of production that was marvelous beyond that of a craftsman.

source_sentence: 輔相見已，倍生信敬，供養供給，觸事無乏。
translation: When the auxiliary minister saw it, he was doubly faithful and venerable, making offerings and making provisions without fail.

source_sentence: 三藏比丘，見其心好，即作是念：「寺廟訖成，俱須眾僧安置寺上，當語輔相使請我兄。」
translation: Seeing his good intentions, the monk Sanzang thought, "When the temple is finished, we must all place monks on it, so we'll tell the auxiliary minister to invite my brother."

source_sentence: 作是念已，語輔相言：「我有一兄，在於彼處，捨家入道，懃心精進，修阿練行，檀越今可請著寺上。」
translation: After he had this thought, he said to the auxiliary minister, "I have a brother over there who left home and entered the path, is dedicated and diligent, and cultivates the practice of araṇya; now, don't you think you could invite him to put him up at the temple?"

source_sentence: 輔相答言：「師所約勅，但是比丘，不敢違逆，況復師兄，是阿練也。」
translation: The auxiliary minister replied, "I've been promised by the master that I'm only a monk, so I wouldn't dare to disobey him, let alone a brother who's an ardent practitioner."

source_sentence: 即便遣人慇懃往請。
translation: He then sent someone to invite them.

source_sentence: 既來到已，輔相見其精懃用行，倍加供養。
translation: When he arrived, the auxiliary minister saw his diligent conduct and made extra offerings.

source_sentence: 其後輔相以一妙[疊*毛]價直千萬，以與於彼阿練比丘，阿練比丘，不肯受之，慇懃強與，然後乃受，而作是念：「我弟營事，當須財物。」
translation: The auxiliary minister then offered a wonderful [pile of *hair] costing up to ten million dollars to that monk Aryan, who refused to accept it but was kind enough to force him to accept it, thinking, "My brother will need provisions for his business."

source_sentence: 即以與之。
translation: He then gave it to them.

source_sentence: 輔相後時，以一麤[疊*毛]，用與三藏；三藏得已，深生瞋恚。
translation: Later, the auxiliary minister gave a coarse [pile of *hair] to the monk; after he received it, the monk became deeply angry.

source_sentence: 又於後日，輔相更以一張妙[疊*毛]直千萬錢，與兄阿練；其兄既得，復以與弟。
translation: On another day, the auxiliary minister gave his brother Ahreum a wonderful [pile of *hair] worth ten million coins; after he got it, he gave it to his younger brother.

source_sentence: 其弟見已，倍懷嫉妬，即持此[疊*毛]，往至輔相愛敬女所，而語之言：「汝父輔相，先看我厚，今彼比丘至止已來，不知以何幻惑汝父，今於我薄，與汝此[疊*毛]，汝可持向輔相之前，縫以為衣。
translation: Seeing this, his younger brother became doubly jealous and took this [pile of *hair] to the auxiliary minister's beloved daughter, saying, "Your father, the auxiliary minister, used to think highly of me.

source_sentence: 若其問者，汝可答言：『父所愛重，阿練若者，捉以與我。』
translation: If he asks, you can answer, 'That's the one my father loves so much, Araṇya, grab it and give it to me.'

source_sentence: 輔相必定瞋不共語。」
translation: The auxiliary minister will certainly be angry and won't speak to you."

source_sentence: 女語三藏言：「我父今厚敬彼比丘，如愛眼睛，亦如明珠，云何卒當而到謗毀？」
translation: The woman said to the tripiṭaka, "Now, my father greatly respects that monk as much as he loves his eyes and as a bright pearl, so why would he deign to disparage him?"

source_sentence: 三藏復言：「汝若不爾，與汝永斷。」
translation: The Tripiṭaka again said, "If you don't, I'll cut you off forever."

source_sentence: 女人又答：「何故太卒當更方宜？」
translation: The woman also replied, "Why is it appropriate to take too long?"

source_sentence: 情不能已，便受此[疊*毛]，於其父前，裁以為衣。
translation: Being unable to stop himself, he accepted this [pile of *hair] and cut it up for a robe in front of his father.

source_sentence: 爾時輔相，見[疊*毛]即識，而作念言：「彼比丘者，甚大惡人，得我之[疊*毛]，不自供給，反以誑惑小兒婦女。」
translation: The auxiliary then saw the [tuft of *hair] and became aware of it, and he thought, "That monk is a very bad person who got my [tuft of *hair] and didn't offer it to himself but instead used it to deceive children and women."

source_sentence: 於是後日阿練若來，不復出迎，顏色變異。
translation: Then, on the following day, when Ārya came, he didn't come out to greet him again, and his appearance changed.

source_sentence: 時此比丘，見輔相爾，心自思惟：「必有異人，毀謗於我，使彼爾耳。」
translation: Seeing the auxiliary appearance, this monk thought to himself, "Some outsider must have misrepresented me and caused this to happen."

source_sentence: 即昇空中，作十八變。
translation: He then rose into the air and underwent 18 transformations.

source_sentence: 輔相見已，深懷敬服，即與其婦，禮足懺悔，恭敬情濃，倍於常日，即驅三藏及其己女，悉令出國。
translation: After the auxiliary minister saw this, he was deeply respectful and deferential, so he and his wife paid homage to him and repented, showing him more respect than usual.

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時三藏，我身是。
translation: The Buddha said, "At the time, this was the Tripiṭaka and myself.

source_sentence: 以謗他故，於無量劫，受大苦惱，乃至今日，為孫他利之所毀謗。
translation: Because he denigrated others, he suffered great suffering and distress for an immeasurable number of eons, and even today, he's been denigrated by Sun Tazo for his own benefit.

source_sentence: 爾時此女，由謗聖故，現被驅出，窮困乞活。
translation: At the time, this woman, because she denigrated the sages, was now driven out and left destitute to live.

source_sentence: 是以世人，於一切事，應當明察，莫輕誹謗用招咎罰。」
translation: Therefore, people, you should clearly examine all matters and not make light of slander, which brings punishment."

source_sentence: （二八）仇伽離謗舍利弗等緣
translation: (28) Qiuqieli's denigration of Śāriputra and other conditions

source_sentence: 昔有尊者舍利弗、目連，遊諸聚落，到瓦師所，值天大雨，即於中宿。
translation: Once upon a time, the Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana traveled to various villages and went to a tile master's residence, where they stayed overnight during a deluge of rain.

source_sentence: 會值窰中先時有一牧牛之女，在後深處；而聲聞人，不入定時，無異凡夫，故不知見。
translation: At the time, there was a cowherd girl in a kiln deep in the back; when śrāvakas aren't in meditation, they aren't like ordinary people, so they don't know what they're seeing.

source_sentence: 彼牧牛女，見舍利弗、目連其容端政，心中惑著，便失不淨。
translation: When that cowherd girl saw how dignified Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana looked, she became confused and attached to her mind, and then she lost her impurity.

source_sentence: 尊者舍利弗、目連，從瓦窰出。
translation: Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana emerged from the tile kiln.

source_sentence: 仇伽離善於形相，觀人顏色，知作欲相不作欲相，見牧牛女在後而出，其女顏色，有成欲相，不知彼女自生惑著而失不淨，即便謗言：「尊者舍利弗、目連，婬牧牛女。」
translation: Qiuqali, who is skilled in appearance and observes the appearance of people and knows when they are acting out of desire and not acting out of desire, sees a cowherd girl emerging from behind her, and she has formed a desire for her color. Not knowing that she has created her own mental attachment and lost her impurity, he even denigrated her, saying, "Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, you've been lusting after cowherd girls."

source_sentence: 向諸比丘，廣說是事。
translation: He explained this in detail to the monks.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，即便三諫：「莫謗尊者舍利弗、目連。」
translation: The monks then even admonished him three times, "Don't denigrate Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana."

source_sentence: 時仇伽離心生瞋嫉，倍更忿盛。
translation: Kauṇḍinya became angry and more enraged.

source_sentence: 有一長者，名曰婆伽，尊者舍利弗、目連，為說法要，得阿那含，命終生梵天上，即稱名為婆伽梵。
translation: There was an elder named Bhagavān, whom Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana taught the essentials of the Dharma and attained non-returner status when his life ended and he was born on the Brahma Heaven, which is called Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時婆伽梵，遙於天上，知仇伽離謗尊者舍利弗、目連，即便來下，至仇伽離房中。
translation: When Bhagavān was far up in the heavens, he knew that Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana had been denigrated by Qoṅgali, so he came down and went to Qoṅgali's room.

source_sentence: 仇伽離問言：「汝是阿誰？」
translation: Qoqalli asked, "Who are you?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我是婆伽梵。」
translation: He replied, "I'm the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 「為何事來？」
translation: "Why have you come?"

source_sentence: 梵言：「我以天耳，聞汝謗尊者舍利弗、目連，汝莫說尊者等有如此事。」
translation: Brahmā said, "With the divine ear, I've heard you misrepresent Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana; don't say such a thing about Venerable Śāriputra and the others."

source_sentence: 如是三諫。
translation: He gave three admonitions like this.

source_sentence: 諫之不止，反作是言：「汝婆伽梵！
translation: When he didn't stop remonstrating, he said, "You Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 言得阿那含，阿那含者，名為不還，何以來至我邊？
translation: It's called nonreturner when it says it's attained nonreturner, so why did it come to me?

source_sentence: 若如是者，佛語亦虛。」
translation: If that's the case, the Buddha's words are also false."

source_sentence: 梵言：「不還者，謂不還欲界受生。」
translation: The Brahma said, "Not returning means not returning to the desire realm to be born."

source_sentence: 時仇伽離，於其身上，即生惡瘡，從頭至足，大小如豆。
translation: Kauṇḍinya immediately developed a bad sore on his body, from head to toe, the size of a pea.

source_sentence: 往至佛所，而白佛言：「云何舍利弗、目連，婬牧牛女？」
translation: He went to the Buddha and said, "How did Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana indulge in sexual misconduct with a cowherd girl?"

source_sentence: 佛復諫言：「汝莫說是舍利弗、目連是事。」
translation: The Buddha again advised, "Don't say this about Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana."

source_sentence: 聞佛此語，倍生瞋恚，時惡疱瘡轉大如[木*奈]。
translation: Hearing this from the Buddha, he became doubly angry, and his malignant blistering sores grew as large as [mu*nai].

source_sentence: 第二又以此事，而白於佛，佛復諫言：「莫說此事。」
translation: The second person also brought this matter to the Buddha's attention, and he again remonstrated, saying, "Don't tell them about this."

source_sentence: 疱瘡轉大如拳。
translation: The blistering sores grew as large as a fist.

source_sentence: 第三不止，其疱轉大如瓠，身體壯熱，入冷池中，能令氷池甚大沸熱，疱瘡盡潰，即時命終，墮摩訶優波地獄。
translation: When the third didn't stop there, his blisters grew as large as gourds, and his body became intensely hot. When he entered a cold pond, it caused the icy pond to boil hot and the blisters and sores to completely collapse, and he was immediately sentenced to die and fall into the hell of Mahāyūpa.

source_sentence: 爾時比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monk then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以何因緣？
translation: By what causes and conditions?

source_sentence: 尊者舍利弗、目連等，為他重謗？」
translation: Did Venerable Śāriputra, Maudgalyāyana, and the others seriously misrepresent it?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「過去劫時，舍利弗、目連等，曾為凡夫。
translation: The Buddha said, "In a past eon, there was a time when Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana were ordinary people.

source_sentence: 見辟支佛出瓦師窰中，亦有牧牛女，從後而出，即便謗言：『彼比丘者，必與此女，共為交通。』
translation: When they saw the Vaiśravaṇa Buddha leaving the kiln and a cowherd girl coming out from behind, they even denigrated him, saying, 'That monk must have shared communion with that woman.'

source_sentence: 由是業緣，墮三惡道中，受無量苦；今雖得聖，先緣不盡，猶被誹謗。
translation: Because of these karmic conditions, he fell into the three bad destinies and suffered immeasurable pain; even though he's now attained sagehood, his prior conditions haven't ended, and he's still being denigrated.

source_sentence: 當知聲聞人，不能為眾生作大善知識。
translation: You should know that śrāvakas can't be great teachers of goodness for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若舍利弗、目連，為仇伽離，現少神足，仇伽離必免地獄；不為現故，使仇伽離墮於地獄，如此之事。」
translation: If Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana had shown a little supernormal power for Qiuqali, Qiuqali would have been spared hell; not to have caused Qiuqali to fall into hell for this reason would have been such a thing."

source_sentence: 佛作是說：「是菩薩人，如鳩留孫佛時，有一仙人，名曰定光，共五百仙人，在於山林中草窟裏住。
translation: The Buddha said this, "Suppose there was an immortal named Tōkyō and 500 other immortals who lived in a grassy cave in a mountain forest when Kakusandha Buddha was born.

source_sentence: 時有婦人，偶行在此，值天降雨風寒理極，無避雨處，即向定光仙所，寄宿一夜。
translation: A woman was walking here by chance, and when the rains fell, the wind and cold were extreme, and there was no place to get out of the rain, she went to stay with the immortal Tingguang for the night.

source_sentence: 明日出去，諸仙人見之，即便謗言：『此定光仙，必共彼女，行不淨行。』
translation: When she went out tomorrow, the sages who saw her said, 'That immortal Cūḷapanthaka must have been with that woman, performing impure acts.'

source_sentence: 爾時定光，知彼心念，恐其誹謗，墮於地獄，即昇虛空，高七多羅樹，作十八變。
translation: Knowing what they were thinking, Ting-kwong feared that they would revile and fall into hell, so he rose into the sky, raised himself up seven tāla trees, and created 18 transformations.

source_sentence: 諸仙人見已，而作是言：『身能離地四指，無有婬欲；何況定光，昇虛空中，有大神變，而有欲事？
translation: After the sages saw this, they said, 'I can lift myself off the ground with four fingers and have no sexual desires, so why would Ting-kwong ascend into the sky with a great miraculous transformation and have desires?'

source_sentence: 我等云何，於清淨人，而起誹謗？』
translation: Why do we denigrate a pure person?'

source_sentence: 時五百仙人，即五體投地，曲躬懺悔。
translation: The five hundred sages then threw themselves to the ground with five bodies and bent their heads in repentance.

source_sentence: 緣是之故，得免重罪。
translation: Because of this, they were spared a serious sin.

source_sentence: 當知菩薩有大方便，真是眾生善知識。」
translation: You should know that the bodhisattvas have great skill and are really good teachers of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時定光仙人者，今彌勒是也。
translation: The Buddha said, "At the time, that was the immortal Tingming, who is now Maitreya.

source_sentence: 爾時五百仙人者，今長老等五百比丘是也。」
translation: The five hundred sages at the time were the five hundred monks who were the elders today."

source_sentence: ◎（二九）◎龍王偈緣佛在王舍城，提婆達多，往至佛所，惡口罵詈。
translation: When the Buddha was in Rājagṛha, Devadatta went to him and slandered him with his bad breath.

source_sentence: 阿難聞已，極生瞋恚，驅提婆達多令出去，而語之曰：「汝若更來，我能使汝得大苦惱。」
translation: When Ānanda heard this, he became extremely angry and drove Devadatta out, saying, "If you come back, I can cause you great suffering."

source_sentence: 諸比丘見已，白佛言：「希有世尊！
translation: After the monks saw this, they said to the Buddha, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來常於提婆達多生慈愍心，而提婆達多於如來所恒懷惡心。
translation: The Tathāgata always has compassion for Devadatta, but Devadatta always harbors bad intentions toward the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 阿難瞋恚，即驅使去。」
translation: Being angry, Ānanda drove him away."

source_sentence: 佛言：「非但今日，於過去世，亦曾如此。
translation: The Buddha said, "Not only today, but it was also like this in a past life.

source_sentence: 昔於迦尸國，時有龍王兄弟二人，一名大達，二名優婆大達，恒雨甘雨，使其國內，草木滋長，五穀成熟，畜生飲水，皆得肥壯，牛羊蕃息。
translation: Once upon a time in the land of Kāsi, there were two dragon kings, one great and the other Upadatta, who used to rain sweet rain so that grass and trees grew in their country, grains matured, animals drank water and became fat and healthy, and cattle and sheep prospered.

source_sentence: 時彼國王，多殺牛羊，至於龍所，而祠於龍。
translation: The king of that country then often killed cattle and sheep, went to a dragon, and worshipped the dragon.

source_sentence: 龍即現身，而語王言：『我既不食，何用殺生而祠我為？』
translation: The dragon then appeared in the flesh and said to the king, 'If I don't eat, why would I be sacrificed for killing life?'

source_sentence: 數語不改，兄弟相將，遂避此處，更到一小龍住處，名屯度脾。
translation: When their repeated words didn't change, their brothers fought each other, so they took refuge there and went to a small dragon named Tundu Spleen.

source_sentence: 屯度脾龍，晝夜瞋恚，惡口罵詈。
translation: That dragon, Tuṣita, was angry day and night, and he slandered him harshly.

source_sentence: 大達語言：『汝莫瞋恚！
translation: The great adept said, 'Don't be angry!'

source_sentence: 比爾還去。』
translation: Pilgrim, go back!'

source_sentence: 優婆大達，極大忿怒，而語之言：『唯汝小龍，常食蝦蟇；我若吐氣，吹汝眷屬，皆使消滅。』
translation: Upadatta became extremely angry and said, 'Only you little dragons always eat frogfish; if I exhale, I'll blow out your retinue and they'll all go away.'

source_sentence: 大達語弟：『莫作瞋恚！
translation: The great penetrator said to his disciple, 'Don't get angry!

source_sentence: 我等今當還向本處，迦尸國王，渴仰我等。』
translation: 'Now, we will return to our original place, King Kāśī, and we'll be looked up to with longing.'

source_sentence: 迦尸國王，作是言曰：『二龍若來，隨其所須，以乳酪祀，更不殺生。』
translation: The king of Kāśī said, 'Suppose two dragons come and offer milk and cheese as they need it, and they won't kill anyone.'

source_sentence: 龍王聞已，即還本處。
translation: After hearing this, the dragon king returned to his original spot.

source_sentence: 「於是大達，而作是偈言：「『盡共合和至心聽，　　極善清淨心數法，　　菩薩本緣所說事，　　今佛顯現故昔偈。
translation: "Thereupon, he became very accomplished and composed this verse, saying, "Listen with utmost sincerity to the unity and purity of your mind, to the things that were originally explained by the bodhisattvas as their primary objective, and now the Buddha is manifesting them, so here's the verse from the past.

source_sentence: 天中之天三佛陀，　　如來在世諸比丘，　　更出惡言相譏毀，　　大悲見聞如此言。
translation: The three buddhas of the gods among gods, the Tathāgatas, and the monks of the world would speak ill of each other and denigrate each other, and they would be greatly compassionate if they saw and heard such words.

source_sentence: 集比丘僧作是說：　　「諸比丘依我出家，　　非法之事不應作，　　汝等各各作麤語，　　更相誹謗自毀害。
translation: The assembly of monks and nuns made this statement, "Monks, you left home relying on me, and you shouldn't do anything that's unlawful.

source_sentence: 汝不聞知求菩提，　　修集慈忍難苦行，　　汝等若欲依佛法，　　應當奉行六和敬。
translation: Don't you hear and know that you're seeking enlightenment, cultivating the difficult and painful practice of kindness and patience, and if you want to rely on the Buddha's teaching, you should consecrate yourselves to the six ways of harmony and reverence.

source_sentence: 智者善聽學佛道，　　為欲利益安眾生，　　普於一切不惱害，　　修行若聞應遠惡。
translation: Wise men who well listen and train in the Buddha's way want to benefit and comfort sentient beings, and they universally abstain from harming all of them if they cultivate their practice and hear about it.

source_sentence: 出家之人起忿諍，　　猶如氷水出於火，　　若欲隨順出家法，　　應斷瞋諍合道行。
translation: A renunciant gives rise to anger, which is like ice and water coming out of fire. If you want to follow the renunciant's teachings, you should cut off anger and combine your practices with the path.

source_sentence: 我於過去作龍王，　　兄弟有二同處住，　　第一兄名為大達，　　第二者名優婆達，　　俱不殺生持淨戒，　　有大威德厭龍形，　　恒向善趣求作人。
translation: In the past, I was a dragon king with two brothers living together, the first named Dadatta and the second named Upādhāra, who both refrained from taking life and upheld pure precepts, had great authority and virtue, disliked the form of dragons, and always sought to be a human being in a good destiny.

source_sentence: 若見沙門婆羅門，　　修持淨戒又多聞，　　變形供養常親近，　　八日十四十五日，　　受持八戒撿心意，　　捨己住處詣他方。
translation: If he sees an ascetic or brāhmaṇa who cultivates pure precepts and is well-versed, takes on a form to offer support and always draws near, he'll observe the eight precepts for eight days, fourteen days, and fifteen days, and then he'll gather his thoughts and abandon his dwelling place and travel to another place.

source_sentence: 有龍名曰屯度脾，　　見我二龍大威德，　　知己不如生嫉恚，　　恒以惡口而罵詈。
translation: There's a dragon named Tundra Spleen who sees the great authority of my two dragons, becomes jealous when he knows he's not as good as them, and constantly ridicules them with his harsh words.

source_sentence: 膖頷腫口氣麤出，　　瞋怒心盛身脹大，　　出是惡聲而謗言，　　幻惑諂偽見侵逼。
translation: His mouth swells with swollen breath, his body swells with anger, and he makes such harsh noises and speaks disparagingly, assaulting him with falsehoods and lies.

source_sentence: 聞此下賤惡龍罵，　　優波大達極瞋恚，　　請求其兄大達言：　　『以此惡語而見毀，　　恒食蝦蟇水際住，　　如此賤物敢見罵？
translation: Hearing this lowly dragon's insults, Upāsatya became extremely angry and asked his brother, Upāsatya, 'How dare you insult him for speaking harshly, for constantly eating frogfish and living near water, and for insulting such a lowly thing?'

source_sentence: 若在水中惱水性，　　若在陸地惱害人。
translation: If they are in water, they disturb the water, and if they are on land, they disturb people.

source_sentence: 聞惡欲忍難可堪，　　今當除滅身眷屬，　　一切皆毀還本處。』
translation: It's difficult to tolerate hearing about bad desires, so now I'll get rid of my retinue and return everything to its original place of disintegration.'

source_sentence: 大力龍王聞弟言，　　所說妙偈智者讚：　　『若於一宿住止處，　　少得供給而安眠，　　不應於彼生惡念，　　知恩報恩聖所讚。
translation: The great powerful dragon king heard what his disciples said, and the wonderful verse they spoke was praised by the wise ones, 'If you stayed overnight at a resting place and received few offerings and slept peacefully, you shouldn't give rise to bad thoughts there; knowing kindness and repaying kindness is praised by the noble ones.

source_sentence: 若息樹下少蔭涼，　　不毀枝葉及花菓，　　若於親厚少作惡，　　是人終始不見樂。
translation: If he rests under a tree with little shade and doesn't destroy branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits, and if he does little evil with kindness, that person will never see pleasure in the end.

source_sentence: 一飡之惠以惡報，　　是不知恩行惡人，　　善菓不生復消滅，　　如林被燒而燋兀，　　後還生長復如故。
translation: A single meal of kindness is rewarded with evil, and this is a person who doesn't know the benefits of acting unkindly. Good fruits don't arise and disappear, like a forest that's burned and scorched but grows back as before.

source_sentence: 背恩之人善不生，　　若養惡人百種供，　　終不念恩必報怨。
translation: Goodness doesn't arise in a person who turns his back on kindness, and if he supports a bad person with a hundred kinds of offerings, he'll never remember kindness and will surely repay enmity.

source_sentence: 譬如仙人象依住，　　生子即死仙養活，　　長大狂逸殺仙人，　　樹木屋宇盡蹋壞，　　惡人背恩亦如是。
translation: Like an elephant that a sage depends on, an immortal nurtures and lives after the birth of a child who dies, grows up and wildly kills the sage, destroying all the trees and buildings, and so does a bad person who turns his back on kindness.

source_sentence: 心意輕躁不暫停，　　譬如洄澓中有樹，　　不修親友無返復，　　如似白[疊*毛]甄叔染。
translation: Their minds are lighthearted and not suspended, like a tree in a swamp, and they don't cultivate friends and family without returning, like a white [tuft of] hair tainted by a man's uncle.

source_sentence: 若欲報怨應加善，　　不應以惡而毀害，　　智者報怨皆以慈，　　擔負天地及山海，　　此擔乃輕背恩重。
translation: If someone wants to respond to enmity, they should be kind, not malicious and harmful. A wise person always responds to enmity with kindness, carrying the burden of heaven and earth and mountains and seas, but this burden is light and carries the weight of kindness.

source_sentence: 一切眾生平等慈，　　是為第一最勝樂，　　如渡河津安隱過，　　慈等二樂亦如是。
translation: The equal kindness of all sentient beings is the greatest and most excellent joy, like crossing a river or a riverbed and passing through in peace, so are the two joys of kindness and so forth.

source_sentence: 不害親友是快樂，　　滅除憍慢亦是樂。
translation: Not harming friends and relatives is joyful, and so is stopping conceit.

source_sentence: 內無德行外憍逸。
translation: There's no internal virtue or external conceit.

source_sentence: 實無有知生憍慢，　　好與強諍親惡友，　　名稱損減得惡聲。
translation: Indeed, there's no knowledge of the arrogance that arises, and he likes to associate with strong friends and relatives, whose names are diminished and which gain a bad reputation.

source_sentence: 孤小老者及病人，　　新失富貴羸劣者，　　貧窮無財失國主，　　單己苦厄無所依，　　於上種種困厄者，　　不生憐愍不名仁。
translation: The orphaned, the elderly, and the sick, the newly deprived and wealthy, the weak, the poor and destitute, the lord of a country without possessions, and those alone in misery and distress with no support are not pitied, which is not called kindness.

source_sentence: 若至他國無眷屬，　　得眾惡罵忍為快，　　能遮眾惡鬪諍息。
translation: If he goes to another country with no retinue, he'll find pleasure in tolerating harsh words and will be able to stop many bad arguments.

source_sentence: 寧在他國人不識，　　不在己邦眾所輕，　　若於異國得恭敬，　　皆來親附不瞋諍，　　即是己國親眷屬。
translation: They'd rather be in another country that people don't know than in their own country that's despised by many, and if they are respected in another country, they all come to be close to them and don't get angry, which means they're close to their own country's retinue.

source_sentence: 世間富貴樂甚少，　　衰滅苦惱甚眾多，　　若見眾生皆退失，　　制不由己默然樂。
translation: Their worldly prosperity and happiness are few, and their declines and sufferings are many. If they see that all sentient beings have retreated, they are restrained and don't let themselves be silently pleased.

source_sentence: 怨敵力勝自羸弱，　　親友既少無所怙，　　自察如是默然樂。
translation: Their enemies are stronger and weaker than themselves, and they have few friends and relatives to rely on, so they examine this for themselves and are quietly happy.

source_sentence: 非法人所貪且慳，　　不信無慚不受言，　　於彼惡所默然樂。
translation: They crave and are stingy with what's not the property of the person, don't believe and accept words without conscience, and are quietly happy in bad places.

source_sentence: 瞋恚甚多殘害惡，　　好加苦毒於眾生，　　如此人邊默然樂。
translation: He has much anger that's cruel and harmful, and he likes to inflict pain on sentient beings, so he is quietly happy at this person's end.

source_sentence: 不信強梁喜自高，　　得逆諂偽詐幻惑，　　於如此人默然樂。
translation: Not believing in strong beams and delighting in self-exaltation, he attains the illusion of flattery and deceit, and is quietly pleased with such a person.

source_sentence: 破戒兇惡無慮忍，　　恒作非法無信行，　　於此人所默然樂。
translation: He breaks precepts, is fierce, lacks tolerance for thought, and constantly commits unlawful and faithless acts, and he is quietly pleased with such a person.

source_sentence: 妄語無愧好兩舌，　　邪見惡口或綺語，　　傲慢自高深計我，　　極大慳貪懷嫉妬，　　於此人所默然樂。
translation: He speaks falsely and blamelessly, has a good double tongue, uses wrong views and harsh words or fancy speech, is proud and arrogant, deeply imagines himself, and is extremely stingy and jealous, and he is quietly delighted in such a person's company.

source_sentence: 若於他處不知己，　　亦無識別種性行，　　不應自高生憍慢。
translation: If he doesn't know himself in other places and doesn't practice the seed nature of consciousness, he shouldn't exalt himself and become proud.

source_sentence: 至餘國界而停住，　　衣食仰人不自在，　　若得毀罵皆應忍。
translation: He'll stop at another world, depending on others for clothing and food, and won't be comfortable, but he'll tolerate criticism if he gets it.

source_sentence: 他界寄住仰衣食，　　若為基業欲快樂，　　亦應如上生忍辱。
translation: If someone lives in another world and looks up to them for clothing and food, and if they want to be happy based on their actions, they should also tolerate it as above.

source_sentence: 若住他界仰衣食，　　乃至下賤來輕己，　　諸是智者宜忍受。
translation: If they live in another world and look up to someone for clothing and food, or if they come from a position of inferiority and despise themselves, it's appropriate for a wise person to tolerate that.

source_sentence: 在他界住惡知友，　　愚小同處下賤人，　　智者自隱如覆火。
translation: While living in another realm with a bad friend or with foolish people in a lowly place, a wise person conceals himself like covering a fire.

source_sentence: 猶如熾火猛風吹，　　炎著林野皆焚燒，　　瞋恚如火燒自他，　　此名極惡之毀害，　　瞋恚欲心智者除，　　若修慈等瞋漸滅。
translation: Like a blazing fire blown by a fierce wind that burns up a forest or wilderness, anger like fire burns oneself and others, which is called a most heinous offense, and which removes anger and desire from the mind of the wise and gradually extinguishes anger if one cultivates kindness and so forth.

source_sentence: 未曾共住輙親善，　　恒近惡者是癡人，　　不察其過輙棄捨，　　作如上事非智者。
translation: They don't even try to be friendly before they live together, and it's foolish to constantly approach someone who's evil, and they don't even try to discard it without examining their faults, for they're not wise to do such things.

source_sentence: 若無愚小智不顯，　　如鳥折翅不能飛，　　智者無愚亦如是，　　以多愚小及無智，　　不能覺了智有力。
translation: If cognition isn't displayed by the foolish and the small, like a bird with its wings broken that can't fly, so too is the wise man without foolishness, because of how many foolish and small and how little cognition there is, he can't perceive the power of cognition.

source_sentence: 以是義故諸賢哲，　　博識多聞得樂住，　　智者得利心不高，　　失利不下無愚癡。
translation: For this reason, good men and women who are knowledgeable and well-versed attain happy abiding, while wise men attain gain without elevating their minds and lose gain without falling back into foolishness.

source_sentence: 所解義理稱實說，　　諸有所言為遮惡，　　安樂利益故宣辯，　　為令必解說是語。
translation: They explain the meaning they understand as it really is, and they speak it to counteract evil, so they explain it for the sake of comfort and benefit, in order to make sure that it's understood.

source_sentence: 智者聞事不卒行，　　思惟籌量論其實，　　明了其理而後行，　　是名自利亦利他。
translation: A wise person hears things and doesn't act on them hastily, contemplates them, deliberates on their truth, and then acts on them after understanding their principle, which is called improving oneself and improving others.

source_sentence: 智者終不為身命，　　造作惡業無理事，　　不以苦樂違正法，　　終不為己捨正行。
translation: A wise person never lives for his own body, creates bad actions without principle, doesn't act contrary to the right teaching with suffering and pleasure, and never abandon correct practices for himself.

source_sentence: 智者不慳無嫉恚，　　亦不嚴惡無愚癡，　　危害垂至不恐怖，　　終不為利讒搆人。
translation: Not stingy or jealous, not harsh or mean, and not foolish, a wise person isn't frightened when harm is imminent, and they never seek to harass others for their own benefit.

source_sentence: 亦不威猛不怯弱。
translation: Nor is he intimidated or intimidated by others.

source_sentence: 又不下劣正處中，　　如此諸事智者相，　　威猛生嫌懦他輕，　　去其兩邊處中行。
translation: They don't descend into the inferior or correct position, which is the mark of a wise person who does such things, becomes intimidated, resents others, and despises them, and goes to either side to walk in the middle of it.

source_sentence: 或時默然如瘂者，　　或時言教如王者，　　或時作寒猶如雪，　　或時現熱如熾火。
translation: Sometimes he's as silent as a dumb person, sometimes he speaks and teaches like a king, sometimes he makes it cold like snow, and sometimes he shows heat like a blazing fire.

source_sentence: 或現高大如須彌，　　或時現卑如臥草，　　或時顯現猛如王，　　或時寂滅如解脫。
translation: Sometimes they appear tall like Sumeru, or they appear humble like crouching grass, or they show themselves fierce like a king, or they become tranquil like liberation.

source_sentence: 或時能忍飢渴苦，　　或時堪忍苦樂事，　　於諸財寶如糞穢，　　自在能調諸瞋恚。
translation: Sometimes they can endure hunger and thirst, or sometimes they can tolerate painful pleasures, and they're as rich as dung, freely disciplining anger.

source_sentence: 或時安樂縱伎樂，　　或時恐怖猶如鹿，　　或時威猛如虎狼，　　觀時非時力無力。
translation: Sometimes he's comfortable with even tricks, sometimes he's frightened like a deer, sometimes he's as powerful as a tiger or wolf, and he observes the power and powerlessness of time and no time.

source_sentence: 能觀富貴及衰滅，　　忍不可忍是真忍，　　忍者應忍是常忍，　　於羸弱者亦應忍。
translation: He can observe wealth and decay, truly tolerate what's intolerable, always tolerate what should be tolerated by ninjas, and tolerate the frail.

source_sentence: 富貴強盛常謙忍，　　不可忍忍是名忍，　　嫌恨者所不嫌恨，　　於瞋人中常心淨。
translation: Being rich and powerful is always humbly tolerant, but intolerant of what's unbearable is called patience, which is not resented by those who hate it and always purifies the mind among those who hate.

source_sentence: 見人為惡自不作，　　忍勝己者名怖忍，　　忍等己者畏鬪諍，　　忍下劣者名盛忍。
translation: Seeing someone do evil, he doesn't do it himself, tolerating the superior himself as he is called tolerating fear, tolerating the equal himself as he fears fighting, and tolerating the inferior as he flourishes.

source_sentence: 惡罵誹謗愚不忍，　　如似兩石著眼中，　　能受惡罵重誹謗，　　智者能忍花雨象。
translation: A fool doesn't tolerate harsh language, like two rocks in the eye. He can accept harsh language and slander, but a wise person can tolerate flowers and rain elephants.

source_sentence: 若於惡罵重誹謗，　　明智能忍有慧眼，　　猶如降雨於大石，　　石無損壞不消滅，　　惡言善語苦樂事，　　智者能忍亦如石。
translation: If someone is able to tolerate heavy verbal abuse and slander, the wise person has the eye of insight, just like sending rain down on a large rock, which doesn't break or disappear, and speaks harshly and kindly about painful and pleasant things, the wise person is able to tolerate that as well, just like a rock.

source_sentence: 若以實事見罵辱，　　此人實語不足瞋，　　若以虛事而罵辱，　　彼自欺誑如狂言，　　智者解了俱不瞋。
translation: If he sees something real and insults it, that person's real words aren't enough to get angry at, and if he insults someone with something that's not real, that person deceives themselves and speaks wildly, but a wise person understands and doesn't get angry at either.

source_sentence: 若為財寶及諸利。
translation: "If someone behaves for the sake of wealth and profit.

source_sentence: 忍受苦樂惡罵謗，　　若能不為財寶利，　　設得百千諸珍寶，　　猶應速疾離惡人。
translation: They endure suffering, pleasure, and harsh words, but if they didn't seek the gain of wealth and treasure, then they'd quickly leave that person even if they had a hundred thousand treasures.

source_sentence: 樹枝被斫不應拔，　　人心已離不可親，　　便從異道遠避去，　　可親友者滿世間。
translation: A branch of a tree that's been chopped down shouldn't be uprooted, and once a person's mind has parted, they can't be related to them; they then go away from another path and avoid those who are close friends.

source_sentence: 先敬後慢而輕毀，　　亦無恭敬不讚歎，　　如似白鵠輕飛去，　　智者遠愚速應離。
translation: He first honors, then belittles, and has no respect or praise, like a white bird that flies away softly, so a wise man who's far from foolish should quickly part with it.

source_sentence: 好樂鬪諍懷諂曲，　　喜見他過作兩舌，　　妄言惡口亦綺語，　　輕賤毀辱諸眾生，　　更出痛言入心髓，　　不護身業口與意，　　智者遠離至他方。
translation: They enjoy fighting and flattery, delight in seeing the faults of others, engage in duplicity, speak falsely and harshly, despise sentient beings, and speak harshly into their hearts, not guarding their physical actions, speech, and thoughts, the wise man avoids going to other places.

source_sentence: 嫉妬惡人無善心，　　見他利樂及名稱，　　心生熱惱大苦毒，　　言語善濡意極惡，　　唯智能遠至他方。
translation: A jealous, evil person lacking a good heart sees the profit and pleasure of others and their names, becomes distressed and greatly afflicted, speaks well and harms their thoughts, and only their wisdom leads them to other lands.

source_sentence: 人樂惡欲貪利養，　　諂曲要取無慚愧，　　內不清淨外亦然，　　智者速遠至他方。
translation: A person enjoys bad desires and greed for profit, flatters and acquires without conscience, and is impure internally and externally, so the wise man quickly goes far away.

source_sentence: 若人無有恭恪心，　　憍慢所懷無教法，　　自謂智者實愚癡，　　慧者遠離至他方。
translation: If a person lacks respectfulness, is proud, and harbors no teaching, they claim to be wise but are really foolish, and the wise go far away to other lands.

source_sentence: 此處飲食得臥具，　　并諸衣被憑活路，　　應當擁護念其恩，　　猶如慈母救一子。
translation: Here, they'll obtain food and drink, bedding, and clothing that provides a living path, so they should be protected and mindful of their kindness, like a loving mother saving her child.

source_sentence: 愛能生長一切苦，　　先當斷愛而離瞋，　　悉能將人至惡趣，　　自高憍慢亦應捨。
translation: Love produces all kinds of suffering, so first you must stop loving and free yourself from anger, which can lead people to a bad destiny, and you must abandon your own pride and arrogance.

source_sentence: 富貴親友貧賤離，　　如此之友當速遠。
translation: Wealthy friends, relatives, and the poor should be abandoned, and such friends should be quickly removed.

source_sentence: 若為一家捨一人，　　若為一村捨一家，　　若為一國捨一村，　　若為己身捨天下，　　若為正法捨己身。
translation: If you abandon one person for a family, a village for a family, a country for a village, your body for the world, or yourself for the right teaching, you'll abandon yourself.

source_sentence: 若為一指捨現財，　　若為身命捨四支，　　若為正法捨一切。
translation: If he were to give up his present possessions for a finger, if he were to give up the four limbs for his body and life, and if he were to give up everything for the right teaching, then he would abandon them all.

source_sentence: 正法如蓋能遮雨，　　修行法者法擁護，　　行法力故斷惡趣，　　如春盛熱得蔭涼。
translation: The right teaching is like a lid that shields the rain, and those who practice the teaching are protected by the teaching; because of the power of practicing the teaching, they stop bad destinies like a spring fever that becomes cool and shady.

source_sentence: 修行法者亦復然，　　與諸賢智趣向俱，　　多得財利不為喜，　　若失重寶不為憂，　　不常懃苦求乞索，　　是名堅實大丈夫。
translation: *So too is he who cultivates the Dharma, goes along with the destinies of good men and wise men, doesn't rejoice when he gains much wealth and profit, doesn't become sad when he loses valuable treasures, and doesn't always strive to solicit, which is called a resolute great man.

source_sentence: 施他財寶甚歡喜，　　世間過惡速捨離，　　安立己身深於海，　　是名雄健勝丈夫。
translation: He rejoices in giving others' possessions and treasures, quickly discards worldly faults, and establishes himself as a person deeper than the ocean, which is called a vigorous and resolute man.

source_sentence: 若解義理眾事巧，　　為人柔軟共行樂，　　諸人歎說善丈夫。』
translation: If he understands the principle of many things and is skilled at them, he's gentle and works together for the joy of others, and people praise him as a good husband.'

source_sentence: 優波大達作是言：　『我今於兄倍信敬，　　假使遭苦極困厄，　　終不復作諸惡事。
translation: Upadatta said, 'Now, I've been doubly devoted to my brother, and even if I were to suffer extreme hardship, I would never again do anything bad.

source_sentence: 若死若活得財產，　　及失財產不造惡。
translation: Whether I die or live, I'll gain possessions and lose them, and I won't do evil.

source_sentence: 兄今當知我奉事，　　願以持戒而取死，　　不以犯戒而取生。
translation: Now, brother, you should know that I serve you, wishing to obtain death by observing the precepts and not obtain life by violating them.

source_sentence: 何故應當為一生，　　而可放逸作惡行？
translation: Why is it that you should undertake a life, but you can be careless and do evil acts?

source_sentence: 生死之中莫放逸，　　我於生死作不善，　　遭值惡友造非法，　　得遇善友以斷除。』」』」
translation: 'Don't be careless in cyclic existence; I've done unskillful deeds in cyclic existence; I've met bad friends who made them unlawful; I've met good friends who will stop them.'"

source_sentence: 佛入宿命知了說，　　告諸比丘是本偈。
translation: The Buddha entered into the knowledge of past lives and spoke this verse to the monks.

source_sentence: 「爾時大達是我身，　　優波大達是阿難，　　當知爾時屯度脾，　　即是提婆達多身。
translation: "At the time, the great penetrator was my body, and Upadatta was Ānanda, so you should know that the spleen of Tundra at the time was Devadatta's body.

source_sentence: 比丘當知作是學，　　是名集法總攝說，　　宜廣慎行應恭敬，　　諸比丘僧修是法。」
translation: Monks, you should know and train in this way; it's called the general statement of the collected teachings, which should be practiced with care and respect by monks and nuns who cultivate this teaching."

source_sentence: （三〇）提婆達多欲毀傷佛因緣
translation: (30) Causes and Conditions of Devadatta's Desire to Disparage the Buddha

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，告提婆達多言：「汝莫於如來生過患心，自取減損，得不安事，自受其苦。」
translation: The Buddha was in Rājagṛha and addressed Devadatta, "Don't give rise to any misgivings about the Tathāgata, which will lead to your own decrease, gain uneasiness, and suffer for yourself."

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「希有世尊！
translation: The monks said, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多於如來所，常生惡心；世尊長夜，慈心憐愍，柔軟共語。」
translation: Devadatta was always malevolent toward the Tathāgata, but the Bhagavān was kind and compassionate throughout the night, and he spoke softly with him."

source_sentence: 佛言：「不但今日，乃往過去，迦尸之國，波羅[木*奈]城，有大龍王，名為瞻蔔，常降時雨，使穀成熟，十四日十五日時，化作人形，受持五戒，布施聽法。
translation: The Buddha said, "Not only today, but also in the distant past, in the country of Kāsi, in the city of Pola [Mūlasarvâstivāda], there was a great dragon king named Campaka who used to send down timely rains to make the grain ripen and who took on human form on the fourteenth and fifteenth days, upheld the five precepts, gave alms, and listened to the teaching.

source_sentence: 時南天竺國，有呪師來，竪箭結呪，取瞻蔔龍王。
translation: At the time, a spell master from the southern Indian kingdom came and struck an arrow with a spell to take the dragon king Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 時天神語迦尸王言：『有呪師將瞻蔔龍王去迦尸國。』
translation: The gods then said to King Kāśyapa, 'A master curse has sent King Jambudvīpa away to Kāśyapa.'

source_sentence: 王即出軍眾而往逐之，彼婆羅門，便復結呪，使王軍眾都不能動。
translation: The king then sent out his army to chase him away, and that brāhmaṇa then formed another spell that prevented the king's army from moving.

source_sentence: 王大出錢財，贖取龍王。
translation: The king then gave them a great deal of money to redeem the dragon king.

source_sentence: 婆羅門，第二更來呪取龍王，諸龍眷屬興雲降雨，雷電霹靂，欲殺婆羅門。
translation: The second time the Brahmin came, he took the dragon king under his spell, and the dragons' retinue raised clouds and sent rain, and thunder and lightning thundered, intending to kill the Brahmin.

source_sentence: 龍王慈心語諸龍眾：『莫害彼命，善好慰喻，令彼還去。』
translation: The dragon king compassionately told the dragons, 'Don't harm their lives; give them good words of comfort and make them return.'

source_sentence: 第三復來，時諸龍等即欲殺之。
translation: When the third came again, the dragons wanted to kill him.

source_sentence: 龍王遮護，不聽令殺，即放使去。
translation: The dragon king shielded them, didn't allow them to kill him, and let them go.

source_sentence: 爾時龍王，今我身是也。
translation: At the time, the dragon king was, and I am, the dragon king.

source_sentence: 爾時呪師者，提婆達多是也。
translation: At the time, the incantation master was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 我為龍時，尚能慈心，數數救濟，況於今日，而當不慈。」
translation: When I was a dragon, I was still able to be kind and rescue many people, so why wouldn't I be kind today?"

source_sentence: （三一）共命鳥緣
translation: (313) Condition of Shared Life as a Bird

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: When the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha, the monks said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，是如來弟，云何常欲怨害於佛？」
translation: Devadatta, this is a disciple of the Tathāgata, so why do you always want to harm the Buddha?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「不但今日，昔雪山中，有鳥名為共命，一身二頭。
translation: The Buddha said, "Not only today, but once there was a bird named Co-life in the snowy mountains that had two heads.

source_sentence: 一頭常食美菓，欲使身得安隱，一頭便生嫉妬之心，而作是言：『彼常云何食好美菓，我不曾得？』
translation: One head always ate good fruit and wanted to make itself comfortable, but the other head became jealous and said, 'How does it always eat good fruit that I haven't gotten?'

source_sentence: 即取毒菓食之，使二頭俱死。
translation: He then takes a poisonous fruit and eats it, causing both heads to die.

source_sentence: 欲知爾時食甘菓者，我身是也。
translation: You want to know that the person who ate the sweet fruit at the time was me.

source_sentence: 爾時食毒菓者，提婆達多是。
translation: The person who ate the poisoned fruit at the time was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 昔時與我共有一身，猶生惡心，今作我弟，亦復如是。」
translation: He shared one body with me in the past, but he still had bad intentions; now that he's my brother, he's likewise."

source_sentence: （三二）白鵝王緣
translation: (32) The White Goose King's Condition

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，提婆達多，推山壓佛，放護財象，欲蹋於佛，惡名流布。
translation: When the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha, Devadatta pushed a mountain against him, released a wealthy elephant, and wanted to trash him, which spread his bad reputation.

source_sentence: 提婆達多，於眾人前，向佛懺悔，嗚如來足；無眾人時，於比丘中，惡口罵佛。
translation: Devadatta, in front of the crowd, confessed to the Buddha and bowed his head at the Tathāgata's feet; when there was no crowd, he was among the monks, and he bad-mouthed the Buddha.

source_sentence: 諸人皆言：「提婆達多，向佛懺悔，心極調順，無故得此惡名流布。」
translation: Everyone said, "Devadatta, who repented to the Buddha and was extremely well-adjusted, has no reason to get this bad reputation spread."

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「希有世尊！
translation: The monks said, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，甚能諂偽，於眾人前，調順向佛；於屏處時，惡心罵佛。」
translation: Devadatta is so skilled in flattery that he submits himself to the Buddha when he's in a secluded place and scolds him with evil intent."

source_sentence: 佛言：「不但今日，乃往過去時，有蓮花池，多有水鳥在中而住。
translation: The Buddha said, "Not only today, but there was a time in the distant past when there was a lotus-flower pond and many waterfowl living in it.

source_sentence: 時有鸛雀，在於池中，徐步舉脚，諸鳥皆言：『此鳥善行，威儀庠序，不惱水性。』
translation: There was a marabou in the pond, and as it stepped forward and lifted its leg, the birds said, 'This bird is well behaved, its manner is peaceful, and it doesn't disturb the water.'

source_sentence: 時有白鵝，而說偈言：「『舉脚而徐步，　　音聲極柔軟，　　欺誑於世間，　　誰不知諂詭？』
translation: Then a white goose spoke in verse, saying, 'It lifts its feet and walks slowly, sounds perfectly gentle, and deceives the world; who wouldn't know flattery?'

source_sentence: 「鸛雀語言：『何為作此語？
translation: "The marabou speaks, 'Why do you say that?'

source_sentence: 來共作親善。』
translation: Come and be friendly with me.'

source_sentence: 白鵝答言：『我知汝諂詭，終不親善。』
translation: The white goose replied, 'I know you're deceitful, but I'll never be friendly.'

source_sentence: 汝欲知爾時鵝王，即我身是也。
translation: Do you want to know that at the time, the king goose was me?

source_sentence: 爾時鸛雀，提婆達多是。」
translation: At the time, that marabou was Devadatta."

source_sentence: （三三）大龜因緣
translation: (33) Causes and Conditions of the Great Tortoise

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，提婆達多，心常懷惡，欲害世尊，乃雇五百善射婆羅門，使持弓箭，詣世尊所，挽弓射佛。
translation: When the Buddha was in Rājagṛha, Devadatta, always harboring evil intentions and wanting to harm the Bhagavān, hired five hundred Brahmins who were good archers to bring bows and arrows to the Bhagavān and draw bows to shoot the Buddha.

source_sentence: 所射之箭，變成拘物頭華，分陀利華，波頭摩華，優鉢羅華。
translation: The arrows they shot turned into kumuda flowers, puṇḍarīka flowers, padma flowers, and upalakṣa flowers.

source_sentence: 五百婆羅門，見是神變，皆大怖畏，即捨弓箭，禮佛懺悔，在一面坐。
translation: Seeing this miraculous transformation, the five hundred Brāhmaṇas were all terrified, so they disarmed their bows and arrows, paid homage to the Buddha in repentance, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 佛為說法，皆得須陀洹道。
translation: The Buddha preached for them, and they all attained the stream entry path.

source_sentence: 復白佛言：「願聽我等出家學道。」
translation: They then said to the Buddha, "May we be allowed to leave home and train on the path?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha said, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著體，重為說法，得阿羅漢道。
translation: His hair fell off his beard, his Dharma robes fell on his body, he repeatedly preached the Dharma, and he attained the arhat path.

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛言：「世尊神力，甚為希有！
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, "The Bhagavān's miraculous powers are quite rare!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，常欲害佛，然佛恒生大慈。」
translation: Devadatta always wants to harm the Buddha, but the Buddha always shows great compassion."

source_sentence: 佛言：「非但今日，於過去時，波羅[木*奈]國，有一商主，名不識恩，共五百賈客，入海採寶。
translation: The Buddha said, "Not only today, but in the past, there was a merchant named Bumian who went into the ocean with 500 merchants to collect treasure.

source_sentence: 得寶還返，到迴淵處，遇水羅剎而捉其船，不能得前。
translation: When they got the treasure and returned, they went to a roundabout and met a water lakṣa who caught their boat and couldn't get it out.

source_sentence: 眾商人等，極大驚怖，皆共唱言：『天神地神，日月諸神，誰能慈愍濟我厄也？』
translation: The merchants and others were terrified, and they all chanted, 'Who among the gods of heaven and earth and the gods of the sun and moon could have compassion on my misfortune?'

source_sentence: 有一大龜，背廣一里，心生悲愍，來向船所，負載眾人，即得渡海。
translation: A large turtle with a back a mile wide became compassionate and came to the boat, loaded it with people, and was able to cross the ocean.

source_sentence: 時龜小睡，不識恩者，欲以大石打龜頭殺，諸商人言：『我等蒙龜濟難活命，殺之不祥，不識恩也。』
translation: When the turtle was small and sleeping, those who didn't realize kindness wanted to kill it by striking its head with a large stone, but the merchants said, 'We've been helped by this turtle to save our lives, so it's bad idea to kill it.

source_sentence: 不識恩曰：『我停飢急，誰問爾恩？』
translation: The merchants who didn't know kindness said, 'I've stopped starving, but who asked you about kindness?'

source_sentence: 輙便殺龜，而食其肉。
translation: As soon as he does, he kills a tortoise and eats its flesh.

source_sentence: 即日夜中，有大群象，蹋殺眾人。
translation: That same night, there was a huge herd of elephants that trampled and killed everyone.

source_sentence: 爾時大龜，我身是也。
translation: At the time, that large tortoise was me.

source_sentence: 爾時不識恩者，提婆達多是。
translation: At the time, that person who didn't know kindness was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 五百商人者，五百婆羅門出家學得道者是。
translation: The five hundred merchants were five hundred Brāhmaṇas who left home and trained to attain the Way.

source_sentence: 我於往昔，濟彼厄難，今復拔其生死之患。」
translation: In the past, I helped them in their difficult circumstances, and now I'm removing the danger of birth-and-death."

source_sentence: （三四）二輔相詭媾緣
translation: (34) Two auxiliary circumstances that make for deceitful coit

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，提婆達多，作種種因緣，欲得殺佛，然不能得。
translation: When the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha, Devadatta wanted to kill him for various reasons, but he couldn't.

source_sentence: 時南天竺國，有婆羅門來，善知呪術，和合毒藥。
translation: At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa in the southern Indian kingdom who knew a spell well and combined poisons.

source_sentence: 提婆達多，於婆羅門所，即合毒藥，以散佛上。
translation: Devadatta went to the Brāhmaṇa's office, combined the poison, and dispersed it on the Buddha.

source_sentence: 風吹此藥，反墮己頭上，即便悶絕，躃地欲死，醫不能治。
translation: When the wind blew this medicine, it fell on his own head, causing him to become unwell and fall to the ground, where he was about to die, and the doctor couldn't treat it.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，被毒欲死。」
translation: Devadatta, he's poisoned and wants to die."

source_sentence: 佛憐愍故，為說實語：「我從菩薩成佛已來，於提婆達多，常生慈悲，無惡心者，提婆達多，毒自當滅。」
translation: Because of his pity, the Buddha spoke truly for them, "Since the bodhisattvas became buddhas, I've always shown compassion for Devadatta and have no bad thoughts about him, so Devadatta's poison will naturally go away."

source_sentence: 作是語已，毒即消滅。
translation: After saying this, the poison will go away.

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「希有世尊！
translation: The monks said, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，恒起惡心於如來所，如來云何猶故活之？」
translation: Devadatta, why does the Tathāgata continue to give rise to evil thoughts in the Tathāgata's presence, and why does the Tathāgata still live?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「非但今日，惡心向我，過去亦爾。」
translation: The Buddha said, "It's not just today that evil thoughts are directed toward me; it was also the case in the past."

source_sentence: 時問佛言：「惡心於佛，其事云何？」
translation: He then asked the Buddha, "What's the matter with that bad mind toward the Buddha?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「過去之世，迦尸國中，有波羅[木*奈]城。
translation: The Buddha said, "In a bygone era, there was the city of Pola [munai] in the country of Kāśī.

source_sentence: 有二輔相，一名斯那，二名惡意。
translation: There were two auxiliaries, one named Sīna and the other named Malice.

source_sentence: 斯那常順法行，惡意恒作惡事，好為詭媾，而語王言：『斯那欲作逆事。』
translation: Sīna always walked in accord with the Dharma, but he always did bad things with ill intent and was fond of deceitful coit, and he said to the king, 'Sīna wants to do something contrary.'

source_sentence: 王即收閉。
translation: The king then shut him down.

source_sentence: 諸天善神，於虛空中，出聲而言：『如此賢人，實無過罪，云何拘繫？』
translation: From the heavens, the good spirits of the gods spoke out in the sky, saying, 'Such a good man really has no faults, so why are he being held captive?'

source_sentence: 諸龍爾時亦作是語，群臣人民亦作是語，王便放之。
translation: The dragons then said the same thing, and so did the ministers and people, and the king released them.

source_sentence: 第二惡意，劫王庫藏，著斯那舍。
translation: The second wicked intent was to plunder the king's treasury and put it in Snatcher's possession.

source_sentence: 王亦不信，而語之言：『汝憎嫉於彼，橫作此事。』
translation: The king didn't believe them either, but he said, 'You hate them and have done this unjustly.'

source_sentence: 王言：『捉此惡意，付與斯那，仰使斷之。』
translation: The king said, 'Catch this malice and give it to Sīna to get rid of it.'

source_sentence: 斯那即教惡意，向王懺悔。
translation: Sna then taught Malice to repent to the king.

source_sentence: 惡意自知有罪，便走向毘提醯王所，作一寶篋，盛二惡蛇，見毒具足，令毘提醯王，遣使送與彼國國王并及斯那：『二人共看，莫示餘人。』
translation: Knowing his guilt, Malice went to King Videha and made a treasure chest containing two evil snakes, complete with poison in their sight, and had King Videha send an envoy to deliver it to the king of that country and to Sna, saying, 'Let's look at it together, and don't show it to anyone else.'

source_sentence: 王見寶篋，極以嚴飾，心大歡喜，即喚斯那，欲共發看。
translation: The king was delighted when he saw how well decorated the treasure chest was, and he summoned Sīna to look at it with him.

source_sentence: 斯那答言：『遠來之物，不得自看，遠來菓食，不得即食。
translation: Sna replied, 'You can't look at something that's come from afar by yourself, and you can't eat fruit that's come from afar right away.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼有惡人，或能以惡來見中傷。』
translation: There's a bad person there who might be able to vilify you with a bad view.'

source_sentence: 王言：『我必欲看。』
translation: The king said, 'I must want to see that.'

source_sentence: 慇懃三諫，王不用語。
translation: He repeatedly remonstrated with him, but the king didn't need to speak to him.

source_sentence: 復白王言：『不用臣語，王自看之，臣不能看。』
translation: He then said to the king, 'No need for me to say anything; the king will look at it himself, but I can't look at it.'

source_sentence: 王即發看，兩眼盲冥，不見於物。
translation: The king then started to look, but his eyes were blind, and he couldn't see things.

source_sentence: 斯那憂苦，愁悴欲死，遣人四出，遍歷諸國，遠覓良藥。
translation: Distressed and weary, Sīna wanted to die, so he sent his men out to search far and wide for a good remedy.

source_sentence: 既得好藥，以治王眼，平復如故。
translation: Once they found a good medicine, they cured the king's eyes and they recovered as before.

source_sentence: 爾時王者，舍利弗是也。
translation: At the time, the king was Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 爾時斯那，我身是也。
translation: At the time, Sena, this was myself.

source_sentence: 爾時惡意，提婆達多是。」
translation: At the time, this was Devadatta, who had ill-will."

source_sentence: （三五）山鷄王緣
translation: (35) The Mountain Chicken King: Conditions

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城，提婆達多，往至佛所，而作是言：「如來今者，可閑靜住，以此大眾，付囑於我。」
translation: When the Buddha was in Rājagṛha, Devadatta went to him and said, "Now, Tathāgata, you may stay calm and quiet and entrust this great crowd to me."

source_sentence: 佛言：「食唾癡人！
translation: The Buddha said, "Spit-eating fool!

source_sentence: 我尚不以諸大眾等，付囑舍利弗、目犍連，云何乃當付囑於汝？」
translation: Why haven't I entrusted Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana with the masses, so why should I entrust you with them?"

source_sentence: 以是因緣，受天果報，身形端正，光明殊妙，眷屬眾多，勝餘諸天。
translation: As a result of these causes, I was rewarded by the gods with a body that's perfectly proportioned, with a marvelous radiance, and with a large retinue that's superior to those of the other gods.

source_sentence: 以修此行故，得果滿足；以滿足故，得最勝果報；勝果報故，一切諸天，無有及者；以無及者，心得快樂也。」
translation: Because they cultivate this practice, they attain fruition; because of that fulfillment, they attain the most excellent reward; because of that excellent reward, there's nothing comparable to all the gods; and because there's nothing comparable to them, they attain happiness."

source_sentence: ◎雜寶藏經卷第三
translation: Śrīgarbha-sūtra, Vol. 3
